title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your knowledge on a wide range of general knowledge topics.

questions.question: What is the capital of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra is the capital city of Australia, chosen as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.

questions.question: Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare is the author of the famous tragedy 'Romeo and Juliet'.

questions.question: What is the largest planet in our solar system?
questions.explanation: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its massive size and Great Red Spot.

questions.question: Which element has the chemical symbol 'O'?
questions.explanation: Oxygen is represented by the symbol 'O' and is essential for life on Earth.

questions.question: Who was the first President of the United States?
questions.explanation: George Washington was the first President of the United States, serving from 1789 to 1797.

questions.question: What is the smallest continent by land area?
questions.explanation: Australia is the smallest continent in terms of land area.

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water at sea level in Celsius?
questions.explanation: At sea level, water boils at 100°C (212°F).

questions.question: Who painted the Mona Lisa?
questions.explanation: The Mona Lisa was painted by Leonardo da Vinci and is one of the most famous artworks in the world.

questions.question: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface.

questions.question: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River in Africa is traditionally considered the longest river in the world, though some debate its ranking against the Amazon.

questions.question: Who is known as the 'Father of Computers'?
questions.explanation: Charles Babbage is considered the 'Father of Computers' for conceptualizing the first mechanical computer.

questions.question: Which ocean is the largest by surface area?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth, covering more than 63 million square miles.

questions.question: Who discovered penicillin?
questions.explanation: Alexander Fleming discovered penicillin in 1928, revolutionizing medicine.

questions.question: Which is the largest mammal in the world?
questions.explanation: The Blue Whale is the largest mammal, growing up to 100 feet in length and weighing over 200 tons.

questions.question: What does DNA stand for?
questions.explanation: DNA stands for Deoxyribonucleic Acid, the molecule that carries genetic instructions in living organisms.

questions.question: Who is the author of '1984'?
questions.explanation: George Orwell is the author of the dystopian novel '1984', published in 1949.

questions.question: Which country has the highest population in the world?
questions.explanation: China has the largest population in the world, with over 1.4 billion people.

questions.question: What is the chemical formula for table salt?
questions.explanation: Table salt is chemically known as Sodium Chloride, with the formula NaCl.

questions.question: Who was the first man to step on the Moon?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong was the first man to step on the Moon during the Apollo 11 mission in 1969.

questions.question: What is the national currency of Japan?
questions.explanation: The Yen is the official currency of Japan.

questions.question: What is the SI unit of force?
questions.explanation: The SI unit of force is the Newton, named after Sir Isaac Newton.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun in our solar system.

questions.question: Who invented the telephone?
questions.explanation: Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the telephone in 1876.

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the world?
questions.explanation: The Antarctic Desert is the largest desert in the world, covering over 14 million square kilometers.

questions.question: Which instrument is used to measure atmospheric pressure?
questions.explanation: A barometer is an instrument used to measure atmospheric pressure.
